description.narrative: Insatsen syftar till att stärka kvinnors rättigheter i Albanien och genomförs av AWEN. Programmet löper över tre år och har en uppskattade budget av 1 162 403 EUR. Insatsen avser bygga vidare på det tidigare Sidastödet genom ”Kvinna till Kvinna” och AWEN sedan 2016. Uppskattningsvis 70% av budgeten avses att vidarebefordras till 9 kvinnoorganisationer vilka alla är medlemmar i AWEN. Stödet har tre komponenter: 1) Främjande- och lobbyingaktiviteter på nationell och internationell nivå för stärkande av kvinnors rättigheter; 2) Institutionell utveckling samt organisationsutveckling av AWEN och dess medlemmar; 3) Stöd till AWENs medlemmar att erbjuda olika typer av stöd, som t ex främjande, kapacitetsutveckling och medvetandegörande, för att stärka kvinnors rättigheter på lokal nivå.

The intervention aims at protecting and promoting women rights in Albania and is implemented by AWEN. The programme covers a three-year period and the total requested budget is 1 162403,41 EUR. The intervention is based on the previous Sida support to Albanian women organisations through Kvinna till Kvinna Foundation and support through AWEN since 2016. About 70% of the funding is forwarded to 9 women organisations that are members of AWEN. The intervention focuses on three components: 1) Advocacy and lobbing at national and international level to protect and promote women rights; 2) Institutional Development and organisations strengthening of AWEN and its members; 3) Support to AWEN members to offer specialised support services, advocacy actions, awareness and capacity building related action to enhance women rights at the local level.

The objective of the programme is: Increased role and contribution of women civil society organizations for the protection, promotion and respect of women human rights in Albania. The specific objectives of the programme are the following: 1. Improved and implemented policies and legal framework for protection and promotion of women human rights.2. Strengthening of institutional/ organizational capacities of AWEN and its members in becoming more democratic, accountable, independent, sustainable and capable to promote and protect women human rights.3. Protection and empowerment of vulnerable groups of girls and women, with a special focus on gender based violence and trafficking survivors.
